resources.string: Select one of the following options:
Enabling GPS satellite communication is recommended for this application. Would you like to enable GPS?

You have pressed the power button on your device while data was recording. To our dismay, this causes sensors such as the accelerometer to stop collecting data. Therefore, we have stopped the data collection process for you and will allow you to upload your data up to the point before the power button was pressed.

Enter a data set description (or leave blank if you\'d like an automatically generated description) and press \"Save\" to save your data set. Otherwise, you may throw away your recently recorded data set by pressing \"Delete\".

Welcome to the iSENSE Data Collector Android Application, developed by UMass Lowell undergraduates Michael Stowell and Jeremy Poulin of the ECG/iSENSE team under Fred Martin.


The Engaging Computing Group “develops new technologies to enable learners - youth, teachers, undergraduates, and others - be creative in science, engineering, and computing, and studies how these technologies improve learning.”


iSENSE exists as a branch off of the ECG, which involves “teachers and kids in inquiry-rich science projects with electronic data collection.” Data collected from iSENSE project may be found on the isenseproject.org website.


This Android application is essentially the general data collection Android platform to utilize the iSENSE visualization tools. With this application, you may simply contribute a data set to an existing iSENSE project. Android devices host many sensors, including an accelerometer, GPS, temperature sensor, gyroscope, magnetic sensor, pressure sensor, proximity sensor, and more. These can all be utilized, should your device support them, to record data and visualize it on the iSENSE website.


The purpose of the Data Collector application is to enable people of all ages to take advantage of the hardware sensors Android offers and use them to take real, personalized data and visualize it using a variety of visualization tools offered by the iSENSE website.


This application will also enable a user to manually key in data live using the manual-entry portion of this app. All the user needs to know is his or her project and login information and he or she is ready to go.


In order to use this application, you must have an account on isenseproject.org.
Select \"Automatic\" to record sensor data, or select \"Manual\" to manually key in data.
What would you like to do with this data set?
Enter a new name for your data set:

You have internet connectivity, but you have not logged into our application yet. Logging in now will enable you to upload your data. However, you can still view your data sets without logging in. Would you like login now?

You need internet connectivity in order to login and upload data. Since we cannot find any of your login credentials and there is no internet connectivity, you cannot upload data sets yet. However, you may still view your data sets.
Please select the fields you would like to record for project #
Step 2: Record a Data Set (Hold Down)
Remember my Sample Interval and Test Length
Welcome to the iSENSE Uploader. Select an option below.
Continue With an Existing iSENSE Project *
What would you like to do?

(long press a field to delete it)
Select a field type from the drop down menu below to add a new field to your project.
